trans-unit.source: Provides methods to manage a collection of <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> is typically used by other controls, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar>.
You can add bitmaps or icons to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList>, and the other controls are able to use the images as they require.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> uses a handle to manage the list of images.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Handle%2A> is not created until certain operations, such as getting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Handle%2A> or calling <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Draw%2A>, are performed on the image list.

Performing other operations, such as setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ColorDepth%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A> will cause the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Handle%2A> to be recreated.
Therefore, you should perform these operations before you add images to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList>.
In addition, when you work with forms that will be localized, you should always add an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> and images when the Language property of a form is set to Default.
Changing the form's language before you add images will corrupt the application resource files.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref> class with default values for <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ColorDepth"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.TransparentColor"></xref>.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList>.
Item
Description
In the .NET Framework version 1.0, the default is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColorDepth.Depth4Bit>.
In the .NET Framework version 1.1 or later, the default is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColorDepth.Depth8Bit>.
The default is a <xref:System.Drawing.Size> object with a height and width of 16 by 16.
The default value is <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Transparent%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref> class, associating it with a container.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> constructor enables you to associate a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> with any <xref:System.ComponentModel.Container> object.
By associating the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> like this, you hand over control of the lifetime of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Container>.
This can be useful if you use a number of components in your application, and want to dispose of all of them simultaneously.

For example, if you associate a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip>, an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList>, and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Timer> with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Container>, calling <xref:System.ComponentModel.Container.Dispose%2A> on the Container will force disposal of all of these components as well.
An object implementing <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref> to associate with this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref>.
Gets the color depth of the image list.
When you set the color depth to a new value, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Handle%2A> for the image list is recreated.

Because setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ColorDepth%2A> property causes the handle to be recreated, you should set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ColorDepth%2A> prior to setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Images%2A> property.

When the handle for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> has been created, setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ColorDepth%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A> properties in code, after setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Images%2A> property, will cause the collection of images set for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Images%2A> property to be deleted.
The number of available colors for the image.
In the .NET Framework version 1.0, the default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColorDepth.Depth4Bit"></xref>.
In the .NET Framework version 1.1 or later, the default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColorDepth.Depth8Bit"></xref>.
The color depth is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ColorDepth"></xref> enumeration value.
Draws the image indicated by the specified index on the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> at the given location.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> to draw on.
The location defined by a <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> at which to draw the image.
The index of the image in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref> to draw.
The index is less than 0.
-or-
The index is greater than or equal to the count of images in the image list.
Draws the image indicated by the given index on the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> at the specified location.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> to draw on.
The horizontal position at which to draw the image.
The vertical position at which to draw the image.
The index of the image in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref> to draw.
The index is less than 0.
-or-
The index is greater than or equal to the count of images in the image list.
Draws the image indicated by the given index on the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> using the specified location and size.
The image is stretched or compressed as necessary to fit the bounds provided.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> to draw on.
The horizontal position at which to draw the image.
The vertical position at which to draw the image.
The width, in pixels, of the destination image.
The height, in pixels, of the destination image.
The index of the image in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref> to draw.
The index is less than 0.
-or-
The index is greater than or equal to the count of images in the image list.
Gets the handle of the image list object.
This corresponds to a Win32 HIMAGELIST handle.
The handle is not created until you need to use it.
Getting the handle causes it to be created.
The handle for the image list.
The default is `null`.
Creating the handle for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref> failed.
Gets a value indicating whether the underlying Win32 handle has been created.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Handle"></xref> has been created; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection"></xref> for this image list.
If the image collection has not yet been created, it is created when you retrieve this property.
The collection of images.
Gets or sets the size of the images in the image list.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A> property prior to adding images to the image collection causes the images to be resized to the image size specified.
When you set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A> property to a new value, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Handle%2A> for the image list is recreated.

Because setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A> property causes the handle to be recreated, you should set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A> prior to setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Images%2A> property.

When the handle for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> has been created, setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ColorDepth%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A> properties in code, after setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Images%2A> property, will cause the collection of images set for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Images%2A> property to be deleted.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that defines the height and width, in pixels, of the images in the list.
The default size is 16 by 16.
The maximum size is 256 by 256.
The value assigned is equal to <xref href="System.Drawing.Size.IsEmpty"></xref>.
-or-
The value of the height or width is less than or equal to 0.
-or-
The value of the height or width is greater than 256.
The new size has a dimension less than 0 or greater than 256.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer"></xref> associated with this image list.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer> is the data portion of the image list.
When you work with forms that will be localized, you should always add an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> and images when the Language property of a form is set to Default.
Changing the form's language before you add images will corrupt the image stream.
You can pass this handle to another instance of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList>.
`null` if the image list is empty; otherwise, a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageListStreamer"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Handle"></xref> is recreated.

You can use this event to do special processing when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Handle%2A> is recreated by actions such as changing the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ColorDepth%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A>.

Special processing may be required because setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ColorDepth%2A> or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A> property after setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Images%2A> property causes the handle to be recreated and the images to be discarded.
Gets or sets an object that contains additional data about the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains additional data about the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref>.
Returns a string that represents the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ToString%2A> method returns a string that includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection.Count%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A> properties.
A string that represents the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageList"></xref>.
Gets or sets the color to treat as transparent.
The transparent color is not rendered when the image is drawn.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> values.
The default is `Transparent`.
